Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a three-run home run in the second inning to tie the game at three apiece.
Teoscar Hernández ripped a two-run single to give Los Angeles a 6-5 lead, and they never looked back.
Pre-Game Insights: No need to welcome Shohei Ohtani to the MLB playoffs — he did it himself.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts praised Ohtani's consistency and uniqueness in big moments.
General manager Brandon Gomes stated that Ohtani would not pitch in the postseason.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers designated hitter Shohei Ohtani (17) hits a three-run home run during Game 1 of the NLDS.
Dodgers’ Shohei Ohtani celebrates after hitting a three-run home run.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani’s.310 batting average ranked second in the Senior Circuit, while he finished with 15 more homers than Marcell Ozuna’s runner-up total of 39.
He added 130 RBIs — 18 more than Milwaukee’s Willy Adames, while finishing three hits being Luis Arraez’s league-leading total of 200.
Others: Dodgers designated hitter Shohei Ohtani (17) hits a three-run home run during Game 1 of the NLDS.
Dodgers’ Shohei Ohtani hits a three-run home run during the second inning in Game 1 of the NLDS.
